intro: Macrosolen angulatus, commonly known as the angular macrolen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often found growing in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
